content: Arrow keys: Navigate menus and submenus
Enter: Select menu item
ESC: Go back or close submenu
Tab: Toggle between menu and output (scroll) mode
i: Enter input mode to type a custom git command
j: Scroll down one line
k: Scroll up one line
gg: Jump to top of output
G: Jump to bottom of output
Page Up/Page Down: Scroll by page
status: Show working tree status
add: Add files to staging area (prompt for files)
commit: Commit staged changes (prompt for message)
init: Initialize new repository
clone: Clone a repository (prompt for URL)
clean: Remove untracked files (prompt for options)
branch: Create a new branch (prompt for name)
checkout: Switch to another branch (prompt for name or via dynamic submenu)
merge: Merge another branch into current (prompt for branch)
rebase: Reapply commits on top of another branch (prompt for branch)
remote add: Add a new remote repository (prompt for name and URL)
remote remove: Remove a remote repository (prompt for name)
remote -v: List all remote repositories
push: Push commits to remote (prompt for remote and branch)
pull: Pull changes from remote (prompt for remote and branch)
fetch: Download objects and refs from remote (prompt for remote or all)
log: Show commit history with graph
diff: Show changes between commits
show: Show commit details (prompt for commit hash)
blame: Show file history with line-by-line changes (prompt for file)
reset: Reset HEAD to specified commit (prompt for commit)
revert: Create new commit that undoes changes (prompt for commit)
cherry-pick: Apply changes from another commit (prompt for commit)
stash: Save changes temporarily (prompt for optional message)
stash pop: Apply and remove most recent stash
stash list: List all stashed changes
tag: Create an annotated tag (prompt for tag name and message)
Press 'i' to enter any git command directly
Command history is maintained
